titles.title: Candidate Anti-Corruption Act

To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit the use of any contribution made to a candidate for election for Federal office, or any donation made to an individual as support for the individual's activities as the holder of a Federal office, for the payment of a salary to the candidate or individual or to any member of the immediate family of the candidate or individual.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 2/13/2003--Introduced. Candidate Anti-Corruption Act - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, as amended by the Bipartisan Campaign Reform Act of 2002, to prohibit the use of any contribution made to a candidate for election for Federal office, or any donation made to an individual as support for the individual's activities as the holder of a Federal office, for the payment of a salary to the candidate or individual or to any member of the immediate family of the candidate or individual.
